summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons NER (National Executive Report) weekly report ending August 16, 2019, from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. Its primary significance is the detailed official account of the discovery, medical response, and pronouncement of death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, listing the cause as 'Alleged Suicide'.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead at the hospital. The report lists the cause of death as 'Alleged Suicide'.

persons.name: Sara Burr
persons.context: Listed in the infectious disease reporting section as an official to be notified of cases, indicating a role within the Bureau of Prisons health or administrative structure.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 a.m., Special Housing Unit staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York. CPR was initiated, EMS was called, and he was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by an ER physician.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York (NYM institution code)
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. N73618-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
The official Bureau of Prisons report lists the Cause of Death (COD) as 'Alleged Suicide'.
Epstein was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. at New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital by an ER physician after extensive resuscitation efforts failed.
The document is a standardized weekly institutional report covering various administrative and health metrics for the Bureau of Prisons.
The report indicates Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the time of his death.
